title: On Nexus 7, still needs work.
comment: I did send details to the developer. Used it only for rendering PDF docs.  It crashed the System UI (user interface) too often, and renders PDF images progressively as tiles; a single page (such as a Key Tronic keyboard layout diagram) takes several seconds. Sorry!  Seeing that others had good experiences, I didn't want to rate it with fewer stars.  Nexus is not rooted and has latest Jelly Bean.

title: Man
comment: One of the most comfortabe djvu and pdf readers
Too slow

title: Lacks bookmarks
comment: The feature I mostly need is bookmarks, otherwise it's impractical to navigate scientific books. The zoom bar also pops annoyingly while scrolling, could I disable it completely? Yet this is the best free app available for reading Djvus.

title: OK but not polished
comment: A decent reader but the lack of buffering makes scrolling look ugly

title: Slow performance, no settings
comment: Dead-simple interface, with no settings at all. Looking at the project homepage, it seems like a dead project, no updates for over a year. It also had an extremely poor performance rendering the PDF of the manual of LG IPS224V Monitor. The cover page of that PDF took a long time (10 seconds, maybe?) to render just a tiny fraction of it. Just for comparison, EBookDroid rendered it instantly.

title: Basic.
comment: Really basic app. People will expect more and be confused.

title: Near unusable on Nexus 7
comment: I hear this is great on other android devices but each page load takes seconds and loads block by block for djvu and PDF files. The same PDF scrolls near seamlessly in ezpdf. Steer clear for now if you're on the N7

title: Not bad

title: Thanks for the DJVU App!
comment: It's a bit slow and sometimes crashes on a file, but is otherwise a great little app, and moreover the only android app that views djvu files, and it works well for that: saves your place in a document, lets you go to a specific page, and zooms.
Renders each page (large image) of one of my pdfs as entirely black, so I must use alongside adobe viewer. Nice bookmarking and page goto features.
Rendering is VERY slow at times. Good app feature is saving your place on pdf doc.... HTC desire.
Forcecloses.
A really excellent pdf viewer. Much better than adobe, pdf viewer or quickoffice. It saves your place, and scrolls much faster than the other apps.
Rendering is a bit slow, but other than that the app is flawless.
Great quality, but super slow
Please enable moving to SD
Doesnt work i tried previewing a pdf attachment and it keeps force closing uninstal
Essential and works well for viewing djvu files, but slow for viewing PDF files.
5 stars when speed up screen update. Very simple and easy to use very good.

title: Displays djvu files well, but no search
comment: It displays djvu files flawlessly. I like the zoom wheel. The full-screen mode is good and the scrolling through books easy and fast. It is also possible to jump to specific pages by page number. However very much missing is a search functionality. Also bookmarks are not displayed and can hence not be used to jump to specific sections.
It was the only app that opened the PDF. Its too slow and takes too long to render.
Force closes ALL the time
Good PDF reader for the price. Has decent bookmarking support, although rendering is slightly slow.
The best PDF reader I've seen. It would be great if it has a better PDF bookmarks support.
Slow on Atrix phone. Superslow on Asus Transformer tablet.

title: Good software
comment: Doesn't crash like Adobe Reader... does the job :)
Works well. Has a go to page # function so it is better than the adobe reader for android. 4 stars only because it loads pages slowly.
Very nice piece of software, thanks a lot!
Good for viewing djvu and pdf documents. With some additional tools or options would be the perfect app.
Loads too slow.

title: Its and Ok djvu reader!
comment: Its an ok djvu reader. And its free so thats a plus and its the only djvu reader on the market... Hopefully the developer will comeback and update it for better support for tablets. This application could be so much better if the code took better advantage of hardware acceleration especially on dual core processors.
